title: Biden and Netanyahu Gear Up for a Complicated New Era
description: The two leaders have forged a relationship over four decades that vacillates between warmth and combat.

title: Rishi Sunak Has a Boris Johnson Problem
description: Already saddled with a budget crisis amid a cost-of-living crisis, the British prime minister has to deal with his predecessor.

title: Netanyahu’s Corruption Charges in Israel: What to Know
description: Benjamin Netanyahu is on track to once again lead Israel as prime minister — while facing a corruption trial.

title: Accusations of Racism Against Lawmaker Roil France’s Parliament
description: A far-right member of Parliament shouted that someone should “go back to Africa” while a Black lawmaker was discussing migrants.

title: Kherson Braces for Battle as Russian Administration Evacuates
description: Evidence points to both sides preparing for a pitched battle for the southern city, and Ukrainians say hints of a Russian military withdrawal are mere deception.

title: Karpov, Former Chess Champion, Is Injured After Fall in Moscow
description: Mr. Karpov has been a loyal defender of Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, and the invasion of Ukraine. But he has also expressed sympathy for the war’s civilian victims on both sides.

title: Your Friday Briefing: A COP 27 Preview
description: Plus Benjamin Netanyahu retakes power in Israel and Imran Khan is wounded in Pakistan.

title: Troubled Loner? Political Terrorist? Both? It’s Often Hard to Say
description: The attack on Nancy Pelosi’s husband has raised questions about the role of demonizing political speech in violent acts, not for the first time.

title: Battle Over Deep-Sea Mining Takes on New Urgency as Trial Run Winds Down
description: A Canadian company is testing mining equipment in the Pacific Ocean in its quest for metals needed for electric vehicles. Environmentalists oppose the mining, which could begin in 2024.

title: The U.N.’s nuclear watchdog finds no evidence for Russia’s claim that Ukraine is readying a ‘dirty bomb.’
description: The International Atomic Energy Agency said its inspections had found no evidence of illegal nuclear activity at three sites that figured in Russia’s claims.

title: US Officials Met With Brittney Griner, White House Says
description: The meeting was the first since the basketball star’s appeal on a drug conviction in Russia was rejected.

title: Warming Made Siberian Fires Worse. The Trend Will Continue, Scientists Say.
description: Nearly 23 million acres burned from 1982 to 2020. But almost half of that occurred in 2019 and 2020, and the region may be near a threshold beyond which extreme fires become more common.

title: Hannah Pick-Goslar, a Presence in Anne Frank’s Diary, Dies at 93
description: The two young women knew each other from kindergarten until their final encounter, on opposite sides of a barbed-wire fence in the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

title: Britain Takes Sides Over a Chocolate Bar That Is Often a Sad Holiday Leftover
description: Bounty, a chocolate-coconut concoction similar to Mounds, will be left out of some Celebrations holiday assortments this year, stirring a national debate.

title: Details in Ethiopia’s Peace Deal Reveal Clear Winners and Losers
description: Fighters in the country’s northern Tigray region, who fought a bitter two-year war against the Ethiopian Army, must disarm within 30 days and allow security forces to take control of Tigray’s capital.

title: In Europe, New Refugee Crisis Stirs Uncomfortable Questions
description: The war in Ukraine has sent the numbers of refugees seeking shelter in Europe soaring, pushing those from other conflicts to the end of the line.

title: Suspect in Pelosi Attack Was in the US Illegally, Officials Say
description: David DePape, a Canadian, legally entered the United States in 2008. He faces several state and federal charges after the authorities say he broke into Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home and assaulted her husband.

title: G7 foreign ministers meet in Germany to make plans to aid Ukraine against Russia.
Can a Nation Replace Its Oil Wealth With Trees?
description: Gabon knows its oil won’t last forever, so officials are turning to the Central African nation’s rainforest for revenue — while also promising to preserve it.

title: Brutal Fight for Kherson Still Looms Between Russia and Ukraine
description: Ukrainian officials have warned that Moscow could be trying to create the illusion of a pullback to draw Ukrainian forces into a trap.

title: Imran Khan, Ex-Prime Minister of Pakistan, Is Shot at Rally
description: At least one unidentified man opened fire on Mr. Khan’s convoy while he was leading a protest march to the capital, Islamabad. Mr. Khan was wounded in the leg, in what aides said was a targeted attack.

title: As Dollar Strengthens, U.S. Students in Europe Feel the Benefits
description: The pound and the euro are trading at decades-long lows against the dollar. For American students abroad, that has made weekend trips, dinners and theater tickets (somewhat) less of a splurge.

title: G7 Foreign Ministers to Discuss Effort to Support Ukraine
description: Antony Blinken and his counterparts are expected to address food and energy issues resulting from the war at a meeting in Germany.

title: The Job Market’s Cues
description: Two measurements tell two stories about the strength of U.S. employment.

title: Netanyahu Set to Win Israel’s Election and Return to Power Within Weeks
description: After five elections in less than four years, Israel will have a stable government for the first time since 2019. But Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition could test the constitutional framework and social fabric.

title: Nations Must Increase Funding to Cope With Climate Shocks, U.N. Warns
description: Failing to help developing nations brace for disruption will lead to increased conflict and widespread suffering, the United Nations wrote in a new report.

title: Indian Drugs, Sold Worldwide, Sometimes Deadly
description: Deaths from contaminated cough syrups in Gambia have brought attention to loose regulations in India and a lack of testing capacity in poor importing nations.

title: Will Qatar Be Ready for the World Cup?
description: As sports fans prepare to flood the tiny Gulf nation, cranes and loaders are still running hard — as is criticism of Qatar’s human rights record and exploitation of workers.

title: The Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant in Southern Ukraine Again Relies on Generators After Shelling
description: It is at least the fourth time the facility has lost connection to outside power since Russian forces began occupying it early in the war.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Here’s what you need to know.

title: North Korea Fires 3 More Missiles Toward Japan, Including Suspected ICBM
description: Just a day after launching nearly two dozen missiles, the North fired off more, one of which officials said appeared to be an intercontinental ballistic missile.
